detailsOfAchievement: "Prerana" is a ray of hope in the midst of darkness for the destitute women, poor children and disabled individuals. Set up in 1992, by the dedicated women of Goraguntepalya. "Prerana" spearheads the struggle for the welfare of the less fortunate people. The main focus of "Prerana" has been the upliftment of neglected, disabled poor girls especially the blind, by training them, providing employment and instilling confidence in them to lead a normal cheerful life inspite of the handicap. Prerana is also involved in many activities for the upliftment of local poor and also to bringing about social and cultural awareness in them. Prerana Resource Center is a center working for the destitute women especially Blind & disabled teen age orphan girls with its main objective as Counseling, Medical assistance, Training & Employment hence leading to Total re-habilitation.. Prerana is dedicated to the service of Blind/Disabled teenage orphan girls from Rural parts of Karnataka from past 20 years. The Important activities of Prerana are: * Providing FREE HOSTEL for 120 Blind/ Disabled/ Downtrodden destitute women. * Short Stay Home for 30 Destitute Women under CSWB, New Delhi. * Counseling service for Blind / Disabled. * Providing Education for Blind / Disabled orphan girls from Interior village. * Orientation and Mobility training. * Home Management training. * Providing Vocational Training like Garlands, Basket Making, Cover Making etc * Organizing Marriages of visually impaired / disabled girls. * Training in Industries & Placement. * Providing aids and appliances / Referral services. * Conducting Awareness generation programes in Interior villages. RECOGNITION : NATIONAL AWARD for Best Placement Service - 2015 STATE AWARD as Best Institution - 2015 NATIONAL AWARD for Best Placement Service - 2001 Dr. B. D. Pallonji Memorial Award from Bombay - 2001 Tara Charities Award from U.SA - 2002 Vishala Karnataka Bhushana - 2004 Karnataka Rajyothsava Award for Social Service - 2005 State Award from Disabled welfare Dept. â€“ 2005 Kettur Rani Chennamma State Award - 2008

title: QUEST Alliance
detailsOfAchievement: Quality Education & Skills Training Alliance (QUEST Alliance) works towards creating powerful learning experiences for marginalized children and youth to realize their full potential. QUEST works on the following core beliefs: Innovate - A multi-disciplinary approach that seeks to immerse in varied contexts and build human centered solutions can create models for relevant and lasting change. Collaborate - Developing new knowledge is a collaborative process that ought to leverage experiences and expertise of diverse partners. Empower - Well designed systemic solutions have the potential to open a world of possibilities and enable learners to construct knowledge meaningfully QUEST Alliance uses creative technology tools to improve the quality of primary and secondary education in India. Using a network of educators, policymakers, corporate and NGO leaders, industry representatives and donors, QUEST identifies and implements innovations in improving quality of education and workforce development, particularly for the most vulnerable through: Building robust curriculum and course structures that address learner specific needs while forming the foundation for a transformational experience Creating a vibrant facilitator platform for continuous support and professional development Designing multiple delivery models to ensure quality and relevance in varied learning contexts Sharing knowledge and engaging with a larger group of stakeholders to mobilize action and policy change through impactful research, demonstration and advocacy.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Workshops and training conducted for Science Graduates, Students of Education, Science communicators on communicating science through Puppetry. in three districts of Karnataka namely Belgaum, Koppl and Raichur. Fifty participants in each of the districts became the delegates of the training workshop. Each workshop was conducted for 5 days. Eminent science faculties and folk artists have participated in the programmes as Resource persons.

the grants was provided by BEMUL Karnataka Milk Federation under STEP scheme of the Dept. of Women and Child Development for formation, nurturing and capacity building of the women Self Help Groups in rural areas of Belgaum district and to organizing Milk Producers Cooperatives of Women. A total of 54 SHGs and 6 Milk Producers Cooperatives of women in Belgaum district established.

Grants provided by United Social Welfare Association of Belgaum under Karnataka Slum Development Board aided IEC activities under IHSDP JnNURM to organize a vocational training programme for 30 women of Ramnagar Vaddarwadi and Gangwadi slums in Tailoring trade. The training was completed successfully.

Grants provided by Public Affairs Centre Bangalore to conduct study in 10 Gram Panchayats in Belgaum districts abour the status and functioning of MGNREGA scheme and Social Audit in MGNREGA. Project completed successfully in conducting study and recommending the measures to the Government through Public Affairs Centre.

The grants was provided by BEMUL Karnataka Milk Federation under STEP scheme of the Dept. of Women and Child Development for formation, nurturing and capacity building of the women Self Help Groups in rural areas of Belgaum district and to organizing Milk Producers Cooperatives of Women. A total of 54 SHGs and 6 Milk Producers Cooperatives of women in Belgaum district established.

The project conducted study of implementation of the scheme Mahatma Gandhi National Employment Guarantee Act Scheme and Social Auditing in it in Belgaum and Dharwad district. The project has also conducted study on functioning of School Development and Monitoring Committees in Belgaum and Dharwad districts. the project was conducted successfully.
